name: theatrically
content:
theatrically adverb
(PERFORMING ARTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that belongs or relates to the theatre, or to the performance or writing of plays, opera, films, etc.: How can theatrically talented kids be nurtured and developed? She writes theatrically exciting plays.
US in cinemas : His latest film opens theatrically next month. "Persuasion" was made for British TV before being released theatrically.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is a very exciting time for this community theatrically. It is an overwhelming experience, musically and theatrically.Her new play is an emotionally and theatrically ambitious work.
